question.title: How to handle Stale Element Exception in selenium?
question.body:
import java.time.LocalDate;

import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;

public class AddEmployeeTest extends BaseTest {
    @DataProvider(name = "employeeData")
    public Object[][] getEmployeeData() {
        return new Object[][] {
                { "John", "S", "Doe" },
                { "Jane", "M", "Smith" },
                { "Thomas", "Alva", "Edison" },
                { "Jasmin", "L", "Desoza" }
        };
    }

    @Test(dataProvider = "employeeData")
    public void testAddEmployee(String firstname, String middlename, String lastname) throws InterruptedException {
        LoginPage loginPage = new LoginPage();
        loginPage.loginToApplication("Admin", "admin123");

        DashboardPage dashboardPage = new DashboardPage();
        Assert.assertTrue(dashboardPage.isLoginSuccessful(), "Login Failed!");
        dashboardPage.navigateToPIM();

        PIMPage pimPage = new PIMPage();
        pimPage.clickOnAddEmployeeButton();

        AddEmployeePage addEmployeePage = new AddEmployeePage();
        addEmployeePage.addEmployees(firstname, middlename, lastname);
        System.out.println("Employee added: " + firstname + " " + lastname);

        dashboardPage.navigateToPIM();
        pimPage.clickOnEmployeeList();
    }
}

I'm trying to automate OrangeHRM website, here I'm using POM. The first employee data is uploading correctly. But for other data it is saying staleementException. After clicking save button it is redirect the page to 'Dashboard' page. Then 'Dashboard' Page keeps reloading itself. How can I handle this?

question_comments.body: We can't give you useful feedback because you haven't provided enough code to repro the issue. See minimal reproducible example.

I hope that when you are using the addEmployees() method, the entire HTML DOM is reloaded there by invalidating the previously stored DashboardPage and PIMPage references. So try to reinitialize the dashboardPage and pimPage reference variables before using them.
